Alternatives

In discussing public policy, most pundits would have us believe that our only choices are: A. government regulation. Or, B. the free market. The lack of imagination evidenced by such discussions is depressing. Surely we can come up with some innovative ideas that don’t simply reproduce past mistakes? Queue

Ted Barlow reprises an old post about health care, and it is still just as relevant.
